meanings.sent1: The new law will legitimise the use of electric scooters on the sidewalks.
meanings.sent2: The court ruling will legitimise the company's ownership of the property.
meanings.sent3: The magician tried to legitimise his disappearing act by claiming it was all part of the show.
meanings.sent4: Her signature on the document will legitimise the agreement between the two parties.
meanings.sent5: The certificate will legitimise your qualifications and make you eligible for the job.

meanings.definition: To give authority or justification to.
meanings.sent1: The president's speech will legitimise the government's decision to increase funding for education.
meanings.sent2: A parent's approval can legitimise a child's choice to pursue a career in the arts.
meanings.sent3: The cat's meow seemed to legitimise its demand for more treats.
meanings.sent4: The trophy will legitimise the team's hard work and dedication throughout the season.
meanings.sent5: The expert's opinion will legitimise the importance of early childhood education.

meanings.definition: To validate or confirm as legitimate.
meanings.sent1: The official stamp will legitimise the authenticity of the document.
meanings.sent2: A signature from the supervisor will legitimise your request for time off.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected win seemed to legitimise the underdog's position in the competition.
meanings.sent4: The DNA test results will legitimise the suspect's alibi.
meanings.sent5: The certificate of authenticity will legitimise the value of the rare painting.
